message.content:
<<<api>>>: Iterator.next
<<<code>>>: boolean isDifferent = !oldList.equals(newList);
<<<explanation>>>: You can use the equals() method of the ArrayList class to check if two lists are equal. This method will return true if and only if the specified object is also a list, both lists have the same size, and all corresponding pairs of elements in the two lists are equal. In other words, two lists are defined to be equal if they contain the same elements in the same order. If the elements of your list are custom objects, you need to override the equals() method in your class to define what is considered to be equal.
